text:
45 y.o.f. presented to OSH on Tuesday with c/o [** **] pain & distention x2
   weeks, as well as N/V.  [** **] xray revealed distended, large, & small
   bowel loops, concerning for SBO. The morning after admission on [**9-1**]
   pt was noted to be hypotensive & tachycardic with low uop & an elevated
   BUN and creatinine of 2. [**Month/Year (2) **] & pelvic CT w/ contrast obtained revealing
   large amts of free air & fluid in [**Month/Year (2) **], as well as contrast within the
   [**Month/Year (2) **] cavity. Pt immediately taken to OR for ex lap, whereupon she was dx
   with perforated gastric ulcer, severe peritonitis, and incidental
   finding of cystic mass in the R pelvis. Underwent evac of ascites,
   exploration, and over seven patch repair of the gastric ulcer with
   placement of a JP drain. Required aggressive fluid resuscitation,
   placed on levo & neo for BP support, and propofol gtt & prn ativan for
   sedation/ETOH withdrawal. [**9-2**] CXRAY showed b/l infiltrates more
   consistent with pneumonia vs. ARBDS. Concern for sepsis. Tx to [**Hospital1 5**]
   under the care of  Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 9318**] for cont management of sepsis, resp
   failure/ARDS, & peritonitis.
   Intestine, perforation of (perforation of hollow viscus) / Sepsis
   Assessment:
   Pt transferred here from [**Hospital3 **]after perforated ulcer/exp
   lap with repair. Transferred to [**Hospital1 **] for further mgmt. Pt sedated on
   propofol 30-50 mcg/kg/min. Pt very sedated, slow to arouse. Off
   propofol for neuro exams.  Fentanyl as needed for pain.  Sr through the
   night 80-90
s , now slightly more tachycardic. Levophed for BP support.
   LS with crackles at bases. Pt with bilateral infiltrates. Sats 93-97%
   on Fio2 70
40 % [**Hospital1 **] distended, but soft. Hypoactive BS, ngt to suction.
   Open [**Hospital1 **] drsg. Anbx continued flagyl, cipro, Vanco, fluconazole. Pt
   afebrile. Jp x1. Bld sugars wnl. Pt with closed fascia, open skin.
   Renal function wnl, lytes ok, lactates with no change.
   Action:
   Off propofol multiple times overnight for neuro exams, pt slow to wake.
   Cont on levophed, wean as tolerates. Ards protocol. Jp outputs. Drsg
   [**Name5 (PTitle) 610**] to [**Name5 (PTitle) **] [**Hospital1 **]. Map >65
   Response:
   Pt remains hemodynamicaly stable. Arousing to deep deep pain, slightly
   opening eyes. No mvmt to arms, LE
s with slight withdrawal on bed to
   pain only. Pt appears comfortable, no acute pain noted.
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor neuro exams, wean levophed. Monitor blood gas
s. Drsg
   [**Name5 (PTitle) 610**]. Follow up cultures, cont anbx.
   Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS, Acute Lung Injury, [**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   Pt in Ards, on ards protocol. Pt on ac 70% 28x360 with peep 10. Pt has
   bilateral infiltrates. Sats 93-97% with Pao2 80-90
s. clear to upper
   lobes, crackles to bases. Pips elevated in high 30
s. Pt has required
   more peep. [**Doctor Last Name **] distended but soft.
   Action:
   Spot gas
s. CPT, suction as needed, vap care.
   Response:
   Slightly improved resp status overnight. O2 down to 40%. Pt has
   required more peep from [**9-9**]. Remains in a resp acidosis. Pips still
   elevated.
   Plan:
   RR increased to try to decrease Co2, ? attributes to neuro exam. ? need
   for specialized bed.
